00001 function varargout = R_viewer(varargin)
00002 % R_VIEWER M-file for R_viewer.fig
00003 %      Run file from main program directory
00004 %      R_VIEWER, by itself, creates a new R_VIEWER or raises the existing
00005 %      singleton*.
00006 %
00007 %      H = R_VIEWER returns the handle to a new R_VIEWER or the handle to
00008 %      the existing singleton*.
00009 %
00010 %      R_VIEWER('CALLBACK',hObject,eventData,handles,...) calls the local
00011 %      function named CALLBACK in R_VIEWER.M with the given input arguments.
00012 %
00013 %      R_VIEWER('Property','Value',...) creates a new R_VIEWER or raises the
00014 %      existing singleton*.  Starting from the left, property value pairs are
00015 %      applied to the GUI before R_viewer_OpeningFcn gets called.  An
00016 %      unrecognized property name or invalid value makes property application
00017 %      stop.  All inputs are passed to R_viewer_OpeningFcn via varargin.
00018 %
00019 %      *See GUI Options on GUIDE's Tools menu.  Choose "GUI allows only one
00020 %      instance to run (singleton)".
00021 %
00022 % See also: GUIDE, GUIDATA, GUIHANDLES
00023

00030 gui_State = struct('gui_Name',       mfilename, ...
00031                    'gui_Singleton',  gui_Singleton, ...
00032                    'gui_OpeningFcn', @R_viewer_OpeningFcn, ...
00033                    'gui_OutputFcn',  @R_viewer_OutputFcn, ...
00034                    'gui_LayoutFcn',  [] , ...
00035                    'gui_Callback',   []);

00037     gui_State.gui_Callback = str2func(varargin{1});
00038 end
00039

00041     [varargout{1:nargout}] = gui_mainfcn(gui_State, varargin{:});
00042 else
00043     gui_mainfcn(gui_State, varargin{:});
00044 end

00048 % =====================================================================
00049 %> @brief Executes just before R_viewer is made visible. Search for
00050 %> Reconstructor objects. Set them in list box. Plot last permittivity
00051 %> distribution map (reconstructed image).
00052 % =====================================================================
00053 function R_viewer_OpeningFcn(hObject, eventdata, handles, varargin)
00054 % This function has no output args, see OutputFcn.
00055 % hObject    handle to figure
00056 % eventdata  reserved - to be defined in a future version of MATLAB
00057 % handles    structure with handles and user data (see GUIDATA)
00058 % varargin   command line arguments to R_viewer (see VARARGIN)
00059 
00060 % Choose default command line output for R_viewer
00061 handles.output = hObject;
00062 
00063 % Update handles structure
00064 guidata(hObject, handles);
00065 
00066 update_listbox(handles);
00067 
00068 
00069 
00070 axes(handles.axessens);
00071 %cla;
00072 %set(handles.axessens,'PlotBoxAspectRatio',[1,1,1]);
00073 list_entries = get(handles.listbox1,'String');
00074 index_selected = get(handles.listbox1,'Value');
00075 if length(index_selected) ~= 1
00076                 errordlg('You must select one element',...
00077                                                 'Incorrect Selection','modal')
00078 else
00079                 var1 = list_entries{index_selected(1)};         
00080 end 
00081 
00082     % display last iter
00083      max_iter=[var1,'.maps_number'];
00084      komenda=[var1,'.Eps_at_iter(',max_iter,');'];
00085     %evalin('base', 'Ef.draw_sensitivity(''all'');');     
00086      evalin('base',komenda);          
00087      
00088      max_iter= evalin('base',max_iter);          
00089      max_iter=max_iter-1; % starting solution is zero
00090      
00091      set(handles.slider1,'Max',max_iter);
00092      set(handles.slider1,'Min',1);
00093           
00094      if max_iter<0
00095          error 'Max iter is less than zero'     
00096      else
00097         max_iter=num2str(max_iter);     
00098         set(handles.text1,'String',max_iter);
00099      end
00100      
00101 % UIWAIT makes R_viewer wait for user response (see UIRESUME)
00102 % uiwait(handles.figure1);
00103

00110 % handles    structure with handles and user data (see GUIDATA)

00116 % --- Executes on selection change in listbox1.
00117 function listbox1_Callback(hObject, eventdata, handles)
00118 % hObject    handle to listbox1 (see GCBO)
00119 % eventdata  reserved - to be defined in a future version of MATLAB
00120 % handles    structure with handles and user data (see GUIDATA)
00121 
00122 % Hints: contents = cellstr(get(hObject,'String')) returns listbox1 contents as cell array
00123 %        contents{get(hObject,'Value')} returns selected item from listbox1
00124 
00125 list_entries = get(handles.listbox1,'String');
00126 index_selected = get(handles.listbox1,'Value');
00127 if length(index_selected) ~= 1
00128                 errordlg('You must select one element',...
00129                                                 'Incorrect Selection','modal')
00130 else
00131                 var1 = list_entries{index_selected(1)};         
00132 end 
00133 
00134 sliderValue = get(handles.slider1,'Value');
00135 val=round(sliderValue);
00136 
00137 % get from workspace
00138 rec_num_max=evalin('base',[var1,'.maps_number;']);% its equal to number of real reconstruction iteration
00139 set(handles.slider1,'Max', rec_num_max);
00140 
00141 if(val<=0)
00142     val=1;
00143     set(handles.slider1,'Value', val);
00144 elseif (val>rec_num_max)
00145     val=1;
00146     set(handles.slider1,'Value', val);
00147 end

00150 % --- Executes during object creation, after setting all properties.
00151 function listbox1_CreateFcn(hObject, eventdata, handles)
00152 % hObject    handle to listbox1 (see GCBO)
00153 % eventdata  reserved - to be defined in a future version of MATLAB
00154 % handles    empty - handles not created until after all CreateFcns called
00155 
00156 % Hint: listbox controls usually have a white background on Windows.
00157 %       See ISPC and COMPUTER.
00158 if ispc && isequal(get(hObject,'BackgroundColor'), get(0,'defaultUicontrolBackgroundColor'))
00159     set(hObject,'BackgroundColor','white');
00160 end

00165 %> @brief Executes on slider movement. Change permittivity

00168 function slider1_Callback(hObject, eventdata, handles)
00169 % hObject    handle to slider1 (see GCBO)

00183                 errordlg('You must select one element',...
00184                                                 'Incorrect Selection','modal')

00187 end

00189 sliderValue = get(handles.slider1,'Value');

00191

00194 set(handles.slider1,'Max', rec_num_max);

00202 end

00205     %evalin('base', 'Ef.draw_sensitivity(''all'');');     
00206      evalin('base',komenda);  
00207      set(handles.text1,'String',val-1);

00244 % =====================================================================
00245 %> @brief Executes on button press in update. Display for selected object
00246 %> in listbox value from pop-up menu.
00247 % =====================================================================
00248 function pushbutton1_Callback(hObject, eventdata, handles)
00249 % hObject    handle to pushbutton1 (see GCBO)
00250 % eventdata  reserved - to be defined in a future version of MATLAB
00251 % handles    structure with handles and user data (see GUIDATA)
00252 
00253 
00254 % select Reconstructor object 
00255 list_entries = get(handles.listbox1,'String');
00256 index_selected = get(handles.listbox1,'Value');
00257 if length(index_selected) ~= 1
00258                 errordlg('You must select one element',...
00259                                                 'Incorrect Selection','modal')
00260 else
00261                 var1 = list_entries{index_selected(1)};         
00262 end 
00263 
00264 % action 
00265 popup_val = get(handles.popupmenu1, 'Value');
00266 
00267 % get from workspace
00268 rec_num_max=evalin('base',[var1,'.maps_number;']);% its equal to number of real reconstruction iteration
00269 set(handles.slider1,'Max', rec_num_max);
00270 
00271 % pop up menu
00272 if(popup_val==1)% eps_map
00273             
00274     % display last iter     
00275      max_iter=[var1,'.maps_number'];
00276      komenda=[var1,'.Eps_at_iter(',max_iter,');'];
00277     %evalin('base', 'Ef.draw_sensitivity(''all'');');     
00278      evalin('base',komenda);          
00279      
00280      max_iter= evalin('base',max_iter);          
00281      max_iter=max_iter-1; % starting solution is zero
00282      
00283      set(handles.slider1,'Value',max_iter);
00284           
00285      if max_iter<0
00286          error 'Max iter is less than zero'     
00287      else
00288         max_iter=num2str(max_iter);     
00289         set(handles.text1,'String',max_iter);
00290      end
00291     
00292 
00293 elseif(popup_val==2)% errors
00294     
00295      fh_error = figure;
00296      name=[var1,' Image, Sensitivity, Capacitance Errors'];
00297      set(fh_error,'Name',name);
00298       
00299      komenda=[var1,'.draw_errors();'];    
00300      
00301      evalin('base',komenda);  
00302      
00303 elseif(popup_val==3)% C_recalculated-C_measured
00304      
00305     % get value from slider
00306     sliderValue = get(handles.slider1,'Value');
00307     val=round(sliderValue);
00308 
00309     if(val<=0)
00310         val=1;
00311     elseif (val>rec_num_max)
00312         val=1;
00313     end
00314     
00315      fh_crminuscm = figure;
00316      name=[var1,' C_recalculated-C_measured'];
00317      set(fh_crminuscm,'Name',name);
00318     
00319      komenda=[var1,'.draw_capacitance_diff(',num2str(val),');'];     
00320      evalin('base',komenda);  
00321      
00322 elseif(popup_val==4)% C_recalculated and C_measured on one plot
00323      
00324     % get value from slider
00325     sliderValue = get(handles.slider1,'Value');
00326     val=round(sliderValue);
00327 
00328     if(val<=0)
00329         val=1;
00330     elseif (val>rec_num_max)
00331         val=1;
00332     end
00333     
00334      fh_crminuscm = figure;
00335      name=[var1,' C_recalculated and C_measured'];
00336      set(fh_crminuscm,'Name',name);
00337      
00338      komenda=[var1,'.draw_Cm_Cr(',num2str(val),');'];     
00339      evalin('base',komenda);     
00340      
00341 elseif(popup_val==5)% params u and alpha
00342      fh_pams = figure;
00343      name=[var1,' Algorithm Params Change'];
00344      set(fh_pams,'Name',name);
00345      
00346      komenda=[var1,'.draw_alg_params();'];     
00347      evalin('base',komenda);     
00348      
00349 elseif(popup_val==6)%  max min measure recalculated capacitances 
00350     
00351     % get value from slider
00352     sliderValue = get(handles.slider1,'Value');
00353     val=round(sliderValue); 
00354     
00355     if(val<=0)
00356         val=1;
00357     elseif (val>rec_num_max)
00358         val=1;
00359     end
00360     
00361      fh_all_c = figure;
00362      name=[var1,' All Capacitances'];
00363      set(fh_all_c,'Name',name);
00364      
00365      komenda=[var1,'.draw_all_capacitances(',num2str(val),');'];     
00366      evalin('base',komenda);     
00367 end

00372 % =====================================================================
00373 %> @brief Search for Reconstructor objects in workspace.
00374 % =====================================================================
00375 function update_listbox(handles)
00376 %http://www.mathworks.com/access/helpdesk/help/techdoc/creating_guis/f6-7673.html
00377 vars = evalin('base','who');
00378 k=1;
00379 any_elements=0;
00380 for i=1:length(vars);
00381         
00382     komenda=['isa(',vars{i},',','''Reconstructor_2D''',');'];    
00383     ret = evalin('base',komenda);    
00384     if ret==1
00385         ef_vector(k)=vars(i);
00386         k=k+1;
00387         any_elements=1;
00388     end
00389 end
00390 if any_elements==0
00391     errordlg('There is''t Reconstructor object in workspace. First run simulation.',...
00392         'Error');
00393     error('There is''t Reconstructor object in workspace. First run simulation.');
00394 end
00395 
00396 set(handles.listbox1,'String',ef_vector)
